title: ICE activity
section: Monthly percent apprehensions leading to deportation
text: Monthly percent apprehensions leading to deportation

title: ICE activity
text:
Daily jail transfers arrests
Arrests where ICE takes custody of an individual already incarcerated by another authority (reactive, low discretion).

title: ICE activity
text:
Daily supervision/administrative arrests
Arrests arising from ongoing supervision, compliance checks, or administrative follow-up rather than proactive enforcement.

title: ICE activity
text:
Daily at-large/community arrests
Proactive ICE-initiated arrests in the community or interior, reflecting high discretionary enforcement activity.

title: ICE activity
text:
Daily border/transport/inspection
Arrests occurring at borders, during transit, or through inspection-based encounters rather than residential enforcement.

title: ICE activity
text:
Daily interagency taskforce arrests
Arrests where ICE gains custody through joint operations or actions initiated by other agencies.

title: ICE activity
text:
Daily worksite enforcement arrests
Arrests conducted through workplace inspections or raids.

title: The Observatory
text: A quiet place to examine social issues and justice measuring the gaps between what we are “supposed” to expect and what we actually see.

title: The Observatory
text:
Contact
If you have any comments or suggestions, please send an email to: theresidualsobservatory@gmail.com.

title: The Observatory
text:
Projects



Observation OBS-001


ICE Arrests Without Criminal Charges
Status: Exploratory
Focus: Administrative detention, legal thresholds, ethical implications
A data-driven look at arrests where criminal charges or convictions are not part of the decision pathway, and what that implies for measurement and harm.

Open →
::::::
:::::::



Observation OBS-002


Counter-Messaging vs Amplification
Status: Methods + simulation
Focus: Asymmetric amplification, containment conditions
A modeling sandbox exploring when counter-messaging can realistically dampen spread, and when it is overwhelmed by platform dynamics.
